answers.answer: You're right that you need to burn more calories than you take in, in order to lose weight.  You should eat your calorie allotment every day to make sure you're getting enough calories; just don't eat those given back to you because you did so much exercise.I assume your "type 1" is diabetes?  Of course, that requires low glycemic diet, in order to avoid spiking blood sugar levels.  I'm not real familiar with SLE, except I know that some of the meds used to control it cause weight gain/inability to lose, so, that, too will factor in.

question: So I've just begun this dieting / exercising and downloaded this app to help (so far so good I think). I'm just wondering about the calories "banked" that shows up on the summary calendar? I figured you need to burn more cals that you consume to lose weight over time, but what happens if you don't consume your cal allotment for the day?Also, I have type 1 and SLE (I suppose this makes some kind of difference in this whole endeavor).
